Posts.Content: Mar 22, 2011 12:03PM - edited Mar 22, 2011 12:04PM by Cariboob Hi Lammo, my heart goes out to you as last Wednesday my heart was pounding when I was having my breast ultrasound. From what I have read the ulstrasound can detect if the lump is fluid filled or not which in my case it was. My mother has had to go onto biopsy three times in her life as the ultrasound detected more of a solid lump and all 3 times hers were B9. Try not to read into too much about what the radiologist and technician said. I am sure the technician was feeling bad at the fact that you were scared and need to go one step further. Sometimes radiologists have no idea of the anxiety we are experiencing just waiting for these further tests and then when they come out with these insensitive remarks, quite frankly, it really ticks me off! Remember the stats that you most likely have a B9 bump. Try and keep busy and think positive! I know, I know, easier said than done :)
Posts.Title: OK, need biopsy. Snarky radiologist, too. iammommy janet58

Posts.Content: Mar 24, 2011 01:04PM Cariboob wrote: Hi Lanus, I had to go into hospital just last week for a callback after routine mammo.  I had a spot compression mammo followed by u/s where they were able to determine that I have a fluid filled cyst. I was told to continue with my yearly mammos and that cysts are pretty much always 99% of the time B9.  I look forward to hearing responses though to your question as the whole callback drama was very frightening and I too want to be aware of anything that I should be doing to be proactive.
Posts.Title: Lump found, not sure what to expect or do... Lanus Lanus

Posts.Content: Cariboob wrote: I am a chicken and admit it.  I just received my mammo reminder in the mail. March will be a year since I had my very first call-back. I am 48. I was traumatized by it and further diagnositcs found I had a cyst and I was put back on the regular annual check. I never was afraid to go for my mammo but now I am afraid to make that call. Will they call me back again for that same cyst that showed up last year?  I will never forget that callback and the waiting game. For those of you waiting - let me tell you I know how you feel and I know that the stats are greatly in our favour that all will be just fine. But a callback is a callback and I will always be a chicken now when I go for my mammogram. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: I'm a Chicken Cariboob Cariboob

Posts.Content: Feb 13, 2012 11:50PM Cariboob wrote: Thank you everyone for all of your thoughts and opinions.  I feel so bad posting when some of you are fighting the beast. My Father died from colon cancer and my Mom just had her upper right lobe removed from lung cancer in December and we found out recently she is one of the lucky ones - Stage1A... my Mom took it all in stride - I was amazed at her strength and courage.  Now its time for me to learn from her. I am going to make that mammo appt. tomorrow. It used to be such an easy call to make... tears here just thinking of all of you - your own individual experiences. For me I do feel it is better to have a few days of anxiety and to be on top of things. I had a colonoscopy in September and had high anxiety about that too but I am glad that I did it as they found and removed two small polyps. Now I don't worry about the colon - well not for 5 years anyway.  Thanks for taking the time to share :)  you have given me the courage and I do appreciate a place to come for support.  PS: We have a small little cabin on a lake in British Columbia in the heart of the Cariboo. It's my happy place and where I got my name "Cariboob"
Posts.Title: I'm a Chicken Cariboob Cariboob

Posts.Content: Mar 30, 2012 09:55PM Cariboob wrote: I just got my letter in the mail... annual mammo this year is fine - no callback. Thank you so very much for the encouragement to be proactive and on top of my health and not a CHICKEN!   Last year's callback was a huge wake up call for me to ensure that I go in for my regular screenings and also to do my own exams which I have been quite negligent in doing in the past.   Blessings to all of you.
Posts.Title: I'm a Chicken Cariboob Cariboob

Posts.Content: Mar 8, 2012 12:42PM Cariboob wrote: Well I made that appt. and going in for my annual mammo next week. Used to be such a routine, easy thing for me to do.  I just wanted to say that I am in awe of all of you ladies who are here. To those that have had scares and to those that are diagnosed and are here to help all of the ladies in waiting and all of the newly diagnosed... inspiring!!!  A question:  last year my diagnostic mammo and ultrasound confirmed a cyst. Will it most likely still be there and will that mean an automatic call-back again for me this year ?  Should I just brace myself to be called back in?
Posts.Title: I'm a Chicken Cariboob Cariboob

Posts.Content: Apr 6, 2011 03:14AM Cariboob wrote: Hi Mara,  I do not have any history of BC in my family but other cancers. I got my very first callback last month and lost 5 lbs in 5 days waiting with anxiety.  Mine turned out to be a cyst. Back to my annuall mammograms. Thinking about you during your wait.... remember that the odds are so in your favour but perhaps you should go more regularly for checks because of your family history.
Posts.Title: 46, f. history, getting divorced...now the callback MaraSara debbie6122

Posts.Content: Mar 19, 2012 04:36PM - edited Mar 19, 2012 04:36PM by Cariboob Skapaya you have certainly been playing this waiting game for quite some time. WOW I am shocked as your first post was in December.  You should win a badge or something for all what you have gone through. Waiting sucks big time and is awful. It does sound VERY positive for you and I am sure on Wednesday morning you are going to be breathing a HUGE sigh of relief.  I know what the waiting game is like - had to go through it this time last year and now I stress about just a regular screening mammo - waiting not to get that callback.    I hope that you find some peace over the next couple of days - your wait is almost over.

Posts.Content: Mar 25, 2011 01:46PM Cariboob wrote: WooHoo Tracy!  I bet you must just feel elated with this wonderful news. I also received a B9 phone call last Wednesday. You are so right - I am so thankful to all of the "angels" here who have been through this and come back to support and of course all of those that have had a C diagnosis and are fighters here to help and support those ladies in waiting. You are truly wonderful people and those of us ladies that have been and are still in waiting appreciate all that you do!  Although I never went to the biopsy stage which I know brings with it a lot more anxiety - just getting the follow-up and further diagnostics - the experience has impacted my life.

Posts.Content: Mar 19, 2011 01:25AM Cariboob wrote: I am in Vancouver, BC and was just reading comments from some posters in our local paper and one guy said the following: I will not be eating any BC Salmon or Alaskan Salmon this year. I am worried about the possibility of a salmon injesting a particle of radioactive Cesium 137, and that particle getting inside me. Cesium 137 remains dangerously radioactive for a long time (half life is 30 years). Inside you, it will cause cancer. So no BC Salmon this year. Sad. But just not worth the risk. Read more: http://www.vancouversun.com/news/Health+Canada+open+nine+radiation+monitoring+stations+coast/4467733/story.html#ixzz1H1Gc582V
Posts.Title: Possibility of nuclear fallout on West Coast Shrek4 Cariboob

Posts.Content: Mar 26, 2011 11:12PM Cariboob wrote: I was just last week confirmed with a cyst and told not to come back for 1 year. I have read that cysts are not cancerous and they can see if a lump is fluid filled via ultrasound.   I am confused. Should I be more concerned? Thanks for any advice.
Posts.Title: Newbie here help input needed please irishlasse KindOfScared

Posts.Content: Mar 18, 2012 12:15PM Cariboob wrote: I feel embarrased saying this but need to share with you ladies.... I just went for my regular screening mammo Friday and now just worried about every phone call that is coming in worrying they are calling me back. I received my very first call-back this time last year and it scared the bajeesus out of me. Further diagnostics resulted in a cyst and I was put back to regular screening. Used to do my annual mammos like nothing, just went in and did them without worry - its a whole new ball game now but in the end I am glad to be proactive about my health.  There was a lady with her husband in the waiting room awaiting a biopsy - oh my what us women have to go through in our lives.  I am surprised though at how many women I know in my life that have never had a mammo and we are all in our late 40's - early 50's. One of my friends who has two teen children just says it freaks her out too much and she says what will be will be. Its amazing what fear can do to us.  I did ask for the thyroid cover this time and was provided with it. The technician said that the mammo machiens radiate downards and no need to worry about it but I said I had read thyroid cancer was on the rise in women and I would like the cover thank you very much.  So here I am waiting for the phone to ring - wondering if I am just a bit insane now - it was just a routine mammo.  Wishing all of you lovely ladies peace during the wait!
Posts.Title: NEW: I need a waiting buddy skapaya skapaya

Posts.Content: Mar 31, 2012 01:04AM Cariboob wrote: I am so sorry to hear of your news Chrissera.  Yes, thank goodness you went for your screening mammo and that it sounds like it may be slow growing.  Thinking of you as you share the news with your family and your Dear Mom - life just does not seem fair sometimes.  Some great advice here from women who have walked your path and doing just fine.  Blessings!

Posts.Content: Mar 20, 2011 12:35PM Cariboob wrote: Hi OJulie67, I rec'd my B9 results last week and just wanted to also let you know I m thinking of you. As my mass was not calcifications I went for an ultrasound which was able to report without biopsy that I have a cyst.  By that time I had waited long enough as the waiting is insane no matter how much you try to keep yourself busy with family and friends it is always at the back of your mind. I too lost 5 lbs in those few days. Something interesting: When I was going from mammo dept to ultrasound dept at the hospital I saw a lady from my highschool grad class (1981) sitting waiting for a diagnostic mammo.... so we exchanged numbers. She is going for her calcification biopsy this Thursday (24th) . Feeling good about 80%!
